title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:

06:47 <venkatesh> has joined #xwiki

08:56 <jamesxu> has quit  
09:00 <jamesxu> has joined #xwiki  
11:54 <Chami1> has joined #xwiki  
12:36 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
12:39 <Chami1> has quit  
12:51 <mflorea> has quit  
12:51 <florinciu> has joined #xwiki  
13:27 <pulasthi> has joined #xwiki  
13:35 <pulasthi> cjdelisle : hi  
13:50 <@cjdelisle> howdy  
13:52 <pulasthi> cjdelisle: hi forked the source for platrom and enterprise  
13:53 <pulasthi> which one will have to hack into for my project  
13:53 <pulasthi> :)  
13:55 <pulasthi> \*will i  
13:56 <@cjdelisle> It will be platform where most of the work will happen  
13:57 <pulasthi> cjdelisle: thanks btw your toy implementaion worked :)  
13:59 <@cjdelisle> yup, after the release tomorrow I'll be able to get back on this full time.  
13:59 <pulasthi> ya i knw ur doing the realse thats why i wasent around these days :)  
13:59 <@cjdelisle> I expect XWikiDocument and the like to be easily presisted since we can just create PersistanceCapable objects for them  
14:00 <@cjdelisle> |       |<--- makes you look dumb  
14:01 <pulasthi> cjdelisle : ? didnt get u  
14:01 <@cjdelisle> "ya i knw ur" <-- is unimpressive  
14:02 <pulasthi> ohh oops i keep forgetting not to use short terms  
14:02 <@cjdelisle> Anyway, the hard part is #1 persisting user defined "objects" and then getting JPQL/XWQL queries.  
14:03 <@cjdelisle> You must text via cell phone, that's kind of a generational thing. I never really had a cell phone, still don't.  
14:03 <pulasthi> hmm i think i should first get familiar with the code base first.  
14:04 <@cjdelisle> Anyway, we need to generate custom PersistanceCapable objects for each user defined object which is why I wrote the test that uses groovy to compile a class, we can generate a class in groovy to represent the user defined object.  
14:05 <@cjdelisle> The other problem is we need to get querying to work  
14:05 <pulasthi> hmm well now we have more time than gsoc  
14:06 <pulasthi> so we can come up with smthing :)  
14:07 <@cjdelisle> Ahh, querying is not that big a deal, most of it is handled in DataNucleus. I have been reading over that code base the past few weeks. JPQL is handled very nicely and (absent a specification) XWQL is really just JPQL with the () notation added.  
14:08 <pulasthi> cjdelisle: ahh great :)  
14:08 <pulasthi> cjdelisle: im going to start building platform  
14:09 <pulasthi> cjdelisle: hope ill get it done without any build errors  
14:09 <@cjdelisle> "doc.object(XWiki.SomeClass) AS obj" maps to JPQL notation "IN(doc.xObjects) obj WHERE obj.className = 'XWiki.SomeClass'"  
14:10 <pulasthi> ahh they are the same when you shuffle them around aren't they  
14:11 <@cjdelisle> yes so as long as we are careful about schema, that is the only thing we need to do in order to get XWQL working  
14:12 <pulasthi> hmm  
14:23 <pulasthi> has left #xwiki  
15:06 <florinciu> has quit  
15:27 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
15:46 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
16:01 <venkatesh> has quit  
17:46 <jvdrean> has quit  
20:05 <lucaa> has quit  
20:08 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
20:47 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
20:47 <polx> Hello xwiki-ers. Does anyone know if the hibernate cache can be somewhat "enlarged" ??  
20:51 <bbc581> has joined #xwiki  
22:08 <@cjdelisle> The level2 cache? I think it could and you would have to look in to hibernate configuration and it would be options in the hibernate.cfg.xml file  
22:08 <vmassol> has quit  
22:08 <@cjdelisle> If what you are doing is loading documents then you may want to expand the document cache instead.  
22:09 <@cjdelisle> the document cache is XWikiDocument instances already in ram which means they will be even faster than hibernate cache  
22:09 <@cjdelisle> OTOH if you're looking for faster queries then the level 2 cache might be your answer  
22:46 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
23:30 <mar3lis> has joined #xwiki  
23:31 <abusenius> has quit  
23:32 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
23:51 <mar3lis> hey guys  
23:51 <mar3lis> http://xwiki.475771.n2.nabble.com/Add-a-user-on-a-User-List-property-td2258743.html#a2274368 i found this threat  
23:51 <mar3lis> and i have the same question  
23:51 <mar3lis> is it possible?  
23:51 <mar3lis> and if yes, how?
